meanings.sent1: The conspirations of the group were discovered by the authorities.
meanings.sent2: The conspirations among the students led to a surprise party for the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The conspirations to bake a giant cake for the school fair were hilarious.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a whirlwind of conspirations, each one more elaborate than the last.
meanings.sent5: The conspirations in the mystery novel kept the readers guessing until the very end.

meanings.definition: A secret plan by a group to do something unlawful or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The conspirations of the criminals were foiled by the detective.
meanings.sent2: The conspirations of the villains were finally exposed in the movie.
meanings.sent3: The conspirations of the cats to steal the treats from the cupboard were amusing.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley was filled with whispered conspirations of betrayal and deceit.
meanings.sent5: The conspirations of the evil sorcerer threatened the kingdom's peace.
